entry.title: Test Installation of Kenchreai Archaeological Archive
entry.content:
Kenchreai Archaeological Archive
Joseph L. Rife, Director, The American Excavations at Kenchreai
Sebastian Heath, Associate Director for Digital Projects


N.B. This is a test installation of KAA [click through for live links]
The Kenchreai Archaeological Archive (KAA) publishes the written records and visual documentation of field-work in and around the ancient harbor of Kenchreai in southern Greece.  This work has been carried out with the permission and oversight of the Hellenic Ministry of Culture and under the auspices of the American School of Classical Studies in Athens. The materials in KAA are presented in an environment that encourages browsing and contextualization of the archaeological information inherent in them. Please note that the archive is in its earliest stages of development so that both the content and appearance of this resource will change rapidly.

KAA is currently working to establish online versions of the identifiers created during the 1960s excavations. Examples are:
  • notebook-a-i: An excavation notebook. With links to identifiers for each page, many with accompanying scanned image.
  • notebook-page-e-i-176: A notebook page.
  • KE0670: An inventoried item. With link to notebook via 'kaa:box-e0121'.
  • KE1828: An inventoried item. With link to 3d-model on p3d.in.
  • kenchreai: A root-level identifier as established by KAA. It signifies the site, work conducted there, and the documentation associated with that work.
Kenchreai in Pleiades
